Polyfill 声称自己受到“诽谤”，域名关闭后返回https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/polyfill-claims-it-has-been-defamed-returns-after-domain-shut-down/ Thu, 27 Jun 2024 06:57:15 -0400阿克斯·夏尔马Securityhttps://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/polyfill-claims-it-has-been-defamed-returns-after-domain-shut-down/ The owners of Polyfill.io have relaunched the JavaScript CDN service on a new domain after polyfill.io was shut down as researchers exposed it was delivering malicious code on upwards of 100,000 websites.. The Polyfill service claims that it has been "maliciously defamed" and been subject to "media messages slandering Polyfill." [...]
Cloudflare：我们从未授权 polyfill.io 使用我们的名称https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cloudflare-we-never-authorized-polyfillio-to-use-our-name/ Thu, 27 Jun 2024 05:18:51 -0400阿克斯·夏尔马Securityhttps://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cloudflare-we-never-authorized-polyfillio-to-use-our-name/ Cloudflare, a lead provider of content delivery network (CDN) services, cloud security, and DDoS protection has warned that it has not authorized the use of its name or logo on the Polyfill.io website, which has recently been caught injecting malware on more than 100,000 websites in a significant supply chain attack.
